question:
You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you provide is executable and can be displayed. 

Please help me implement the following requirements using code, with the creation to be done in SVG: Create a close-up portrait of a person holding a box in their hands.

checklist.title: Is the basic SVG structure correctly implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the code includes proper SVG namespace, viewBox definition, and appropriate dimensions. The SVG element should have width/height attributes or CSS styling that makes it responsive. Deduct 5 points if the SVG lacks proper viewport settings, 5 points if namespaces are missing, and 3 points if responsive design is not considered. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the human face accurately and proportionally rendered?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether facial features (eyes, nose, mouth, ears) are drawn with proper proportions and positioning. The face should show depth through shading and have realistic or stylistically consistent features. Score 0 if facial features are missing or severely distorted, 5 if proportions are slightly off but recognizable, and 10 if the face appears professionally crafted with proper anatomical understanding. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are the hands holding the box drawn with anatomical accuracy?
checklist.description: Review the hand structure (proper finger proportions, natural positioning) and the hand-box interaction (realistic grip, appropriate tension). Hands should show proper perspective and include details like knuckles and fingernails. Deduct 5 points if hands appear anatomically incorrect, 3 points if the grip on the box looks unnatural, and 2 points if hands lack depth or detail. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the box drawn with correct perspective and dimension?
checklist.description: Check if the box shows proper 3D perspective with consistent vanishing points, correct corner angles, and appropriate size relative to the hands. The box should appear to have weight and volume. Deduct 5 points for perspective inconsistencies, 3 points if the box lacks dimensional consistency, and 2 points if the box appears weightless or flat. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code handles browser compatibility issues, uses appropriate fallbacks for unsupported features, and avoids hard-coded values that might break in different contexts. Code with strong robustness should work across major browsers and screen sizes, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if major compatibility issues exist, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the visual experience (e.g., 1. Subtle animation like blinking or breathing effect 2. Interactive elements that respond to user input 3. Creative use of gradients or patterns for added realism). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant SVG elements or groups that serve identical purposes 2. Excessive or unnecessary detail that complicates the code without visual benefit 3. Over-complicated effects that could be achieved with simpler methods. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core visual elements are obscured by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular structure (logical grouping of SVG elements), code reusability (use of <defs> and patterns), and overall code organization. Deduct 5 points if elements aren't properly grouped or named; deduct 5 points if the code is excessively verbose with duplicate definitions; deduct 5 points if there's no separation between structural and stylistic elements. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the portrait meet professional artistic standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the portrait follows artistic principles: 1) Balanced composition with proper focal point 2) Effective use of color theory and shading 3) Appropriate level of detail with visual hierarchy. Deduct 3 points for compositional imbalance, 5 points for unrealistic or jarring color choices, and 5 points for flat rendering without depth. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the SVG optimized for performance and filesize?
checklist.description: Judge whether the SVG implementation is efficient: 1) Appropriate use of primitives vs. path elements 2) Optimization of path data (minimal points, no unnecessary precision) 3) Proper use of groups to reduce redundancy. Deduct 5 points for unnecessarily complex paths, 3 points for excessive precision in numerical values, and 5 points for failure to use appropriate SVG features (like symbols or gradients) where beneficial. The full score is 10 points.
